availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry William Harrington (Jefferson County, Indiana, attorney and representative)

body.p: Jefferson County, Indiana, attorney and congressman. New York native. Married to Adaline Harrison Harrington in Livingston County, New York, on December 11, 1847. Father of Adalade Harrington and Emma Harrington. Married to Emma Harrington in 1860. Father of Henry Harrington. Attended school at Temple Hill Academy in Livingston County, New York, from 1845 to 1848. Attorney in Cattaraugus County, New York, in 1850. Attorney in Cattaraugus County in 1855. Attorney in Jefferson County, Indiana, in 1860. Member of the Democratic Party. Delegate to the Democratic National Convention from Indiana in Baltimore, Maryland in 1860. Member of the House of Representatives of the United States from Indiana from March 4, 1863 to March 3, 1865.
